Text: Sing to the LORD a new song; sing to the LORD, all the earth.
Context: Calls for a new expression of praise that encompasses all of creation.

Text: Sing to the LORD, bless His name; proclaim His salvation day after day.
Context: Encouragement to continually acknowledge God's deliverance.

Text: Declare His glory among the nations, His marvelous deeds among all peoples.
Context: Emphasizes the importance of sharing God's majesty and works globally.

Text: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
Context: Acknowledging God's supremacy over any so-called gods.

Text: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
Context: Contrasts the false gods with the Creator God.

Text: Splendor and majesty are before Him; strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
Context: Describes the divine attributes of God.

Text: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
Context: Call for people to attribute the rightful honor to God.

Text: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name; bring an offering and come into His courts.
Worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness; tremble before Him, all the earth.
Context: Call to approach God with appropriate reverence and awe.

Text: Say among the nations, “The LORD reigns.” The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved; He will judge the peoples with equity.
Context: Proclamation of God's sovereignty and just rule.

Text: Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad; let the sea resound, and all that is in it.
Context: An invitation for all creation to be joyful in God.

Text: Let the fields exult, and everything in them; then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy
Context: A poetic personification of nature celebrating God's reign.

Text: Before the LORD, for He comes, for He comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples in His faithfulness.
Context: Expectation of God's just and faithful judgment.
